title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\CorsPolicy
name: CorsPolicy
description:
The specification for allowing client-side cross-origin requests. For more information about the W3C recommendation for cross-origin resource sharing (CORS), see Fetch API Living Standard.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.CorsPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.allow_credentials
params.description: In response to a preflight request, setting this to true indicates that the actual request can include user credentials. This field translates to the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header. Default is false.

params.name: data.allow_headers
params.description: Specifies the content for the Access-Control-Allow-Headers header.

params.name: data.allow_methods
params.description: Specifies the content for the Access-Control-Allow-Methods header.

params.name: data.allow_origin_regexes
params.description: Specifies a regular expression that matches allowed origins. For more information about the regular expression syntax, see Syntax. An origin is allowed if it matches either an item in allowOrigins or an item in allowOriginRegexes.

params.name: data.allow_origins
params.description: Specifies the list of origins that is allowed to do CORS requests. An origin is allowed if it matches either an item in allowOrigins or an item in allowOriginRegexes.

params.name: data.disabled
params.description: If true, the setting specifies the CORS policy is disabled. The default value of false, which indicates that the CORS policy is in effect.

params.name: data.expose_headers
params.description: Specifies the content for the Access-Control-Expose-Headers header.

params.name: data.max_age
params.description: Specifies how long results of a preflight request can be cached in seconds. This field translates to the Access-Control-Max-Age header.
